titles.title: National Defense Energy Savings Act of 2004

A bill to expand upon the Department of Defense Energy Efficiency Program required by section 317 of the National Defense Authorization Act of 2002 by authorizing the Secretary of Defense to enter into energy savings performance contracts, and for other purposes.
National Defense Energy Savings Act of 2004

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Armed Services.

term.name: Cogeneration of electric power and heat

bill.summary:
National Defense Energy Savings Act of 2004 - Authorizes the Secretary of Defense to: (1) enter into an energy savings performance contract in order to achieve energy savings and ancillary benefits; (2) incur obligations under the contract to finance energy conservation measures so long as guaranteed savings exceed the debt service requirements; and (3) implement a pilot program to enter into up to ten energy savings performance contracts for the purpose of achieving energy savings, secondary savings, and incidental benefits, in nonbuilding applications.
Sets forth implementation guidelines, including contract terms and conditions.
